urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
Scientists are now testing sewage samples to detect local #coronavirus outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbk0ofA

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/4xdR82CtJo

tweets.text:
WATCH: Here‚Äôs Dave in the rewilded #Surbiton Stream in south-west London. 

Working to restore rivers for wildlife and for the future! 
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek @RBKingston https://t.co/ZGU8kSbvOz

Our staff have been working with @EnvAgencyMids and @BhamCityCouncil to renaturalise parts of the River Cole, adding curve, creating habitats & improving conditions for fish and invertebrate population movements. It‚Äôs part of our vision to improve the river for wildlife & people https://t.co/4xPmOEt3Aa
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Not only sewage but now wet wipes, sanitary towels, condoms etc.

@CleanIlkley @EmmaHowardBoyd @BBCWomensHour @KarenShackleto5 The very people who created this sorry situation are now trying to suggest they can fix it. 

I've said it before the @EnvAgency have no credibility left in this conversation.

@CertusCC @Feargal_Sharkey @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour @JamesBevanEA Maybe but she and JB have also been diverting those funds from investigation and WQ to the utterly pointless. They are undoubtedly at the heart of the problem and now part of the cover-up task force.

We're holding a virtual public meeting to discuss our plans for new Bishopthorpe flood defences in York, 6.30pm on Wednesday 4 November.

Join us via  zoom  
ID: 812 6062 9756
Password: YorkC1

Ask any questions with Slido (code #YorkC1) before or during the event
#Flood #YorkFAS https://t.co/wOHlRkGkzH
@Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd EBH joined the board of the @EnvAgency in 2009. What has she done about it during the last 11 years? @BBCWomansHour

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

@Feargal_Sharkey @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour So the government have no responsibility in any of this ? I may have missed your stinging criticism of numerous minsters failing to provide adequate funding ?

How come @robertjenrick Planning White Paper has NO detail and asks for NO feedback on the #environmental, #biodiversity and #heritage effects of the plans? If are planned protections are purposefully unclear. @NaturalEngland  @HistoricEngland @EnvAgency https://t.co/jSDlzodRaK

tweets.text: @Feargal_Sharkey @Ilkley_BM @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour If it‚Äôs true that government has underfunded @EnvAgency, @EmmaHowardBoyd and @JamesBevanEA should have been loudly holding HMG to account, and resigned on principle if their financial demands weren‚Äôt met.

Yes good to see some analysis to explain the capacity gap that exists between rising environmental ambitions & the ability to deliver on that. @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency ready to do the job, but we need the means https://t.co/bEZkSXnDPm
@WTBBC @EnvAgencyMids @BhamCityCouncil Good to hear! Where exactly? Thanks!
@Feargal_Sharkey @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @BBCWomansHour It‚Äôs taken a public campaign to bring this stage front to regulators. Now it‚Äôs there we have to be part of the solution

2/5: This highlight's the gaping chasm between @BorisJohnson's rhetoric on ambition for nature & the shocking reality. Swinging cuts to the budgets & staff of @NaturalEngland (who failed to field a spokesman??) and of @EnvAgency

tweets.text:
"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text üëá https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

Fisheries Specialist @MattBuckEA told @BBCNottingham how his team felt privileged to be part of the restocking of fish at Duke's Lake @DNRCOfficial so armed forces personnel going through rehabilitation will be able to #getfishing 

 https://t.co/9IruCGMgMG (3hr 2mins 55secs in) https://t.co/zefm4wpP0v

@EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency it‚Äôs been 346 days since this flow meter stopped working on 16/11/2019, and you haven‚Äôt done anything to fix it. Just under 3 weeks until it‚Äôs been a full YEAR of neglect... ü§î Can we get it sorted? Ref # 1852967 (1/2) https://t.co/xv0CPyp8jr
@janegarvey1 @BBCWomansHour @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @CleanIlkley Please state that no rivers in England past the pollution levels - they are all polluted!!
On 26/10/20 at 00:00 the flow was 0m¬≥/s. https://t.co/JkuNRl47b0

So @EmmaHowardBoyd if you want to really use a taskforce to make a difference you need public representatives not just the agencies and water companies. The public are both consumers and payers and need a voice @BBCWomensHour @KarenShackleto5
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/IpnaNQ1Ucf

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Had some mates fishing a Barbel match on the river Derwent in Derbyshire on Saturday , match was cancelled halfway through due to a raw sewage discharge up stream, one mate is now ill after removing human waste off his line, total disgrace üò°.

How many other rivers in England are having vast amounts of raw sewage dumped into them at this very second? "Exceptional circumstance"?

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/8rarB1lphZ
Interesting @EmmaHowardBoyd now says regulator doesn‚Äôt have enough money - needed to say that years ago https://t.co/7TJx3vio3s

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
Our scientists have made a breakthrough in supporting the UK‚Äôs response to #coronavirus.

We can now use sewage samples provided by water companies to detect local outbreaks, even when people don‚Äôt show symptoms.

Read more: https://t.co/VlvDhIA8I9

#CovidSewageTesting #TeamEA https://t.co/rhsdlZLGYE

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.
